TravelTriangle > Blog > Kerala > 10 Romantic Beaches In Kerala You Must Visit For A Soulful Vacay! 10 Romantic Beaches In Kerala You Must Visit For A Soulful Vacay! .. SHARES Updated Date: 2 September 2025 If you want to beat the crowds and enjoy a beach vacation with your loved one, then head straight to the shores of Kerala. For a discerning traveler, best sea beach in Kerala is a wonderful mix of tranquility, charm, and towering pines dotting the coastal area. Besides being famous for its backwaters and lush green hillsides, there are some of the best romantic beaches in Kerala on the west coast. Table Of Content 10 Most Romantic Beaches In Kerala We’ve compiled a list of the most romantic beaches in Kerala that every couple should explore. Be it spending quality time together or trying out adventure activities, these beaches offer it all. Kovalam Beach: For Friends & Family Kappad Beach: Beach With Historical Importance Kannur Beach: Lesser Known But Beautiful Marari Beach: For The Romantic Setting Cherai Beach: Perfect For Beach Fishing Varkala Beach: Peaceful Is The Word Alappuzha Beach: Picturesque Got A New Name Somatheeram Beach: Popular For The Ayurvedic Resort Bekal Beach: Beach With A Fort Payyoli Beach: Quiet & Desolate But Stunning 1. Kovalam Beach: For Friends & Family Kovalam is a beachside, quaint little town near Thiruvananthapuram. This town has three beaches, separated by rocks. The Lighthouse beach is one of the most romantic beaches in Kerala and is considered as the paradise of the south. Things to do: Check out the three beaches at Kovalam i.e. Lighthouse beach, Kovalam beach and Hawa Beach, Also see the Neyyar DamPlaces to eat: 3rd Rock, Bait, Oyster Restaurant, Curry Leaf, Varsha restaurant, Malabar CafePopular beach resorts: The Leela, Golden Sands, Royal sea Blue, Turtle on the beach Must Read: The Ultimate Guide to Top Tourist Places in Kerala Kerala Honeymoon Packages On TravelTriangle A honeymoon in Kerala will fill you with memories. Witness pristine backwaters with comfortable houseboats, lush green hill stations, waterfalls, and plantations of tea and spice. Indulge in an ayurvedic massage or taste exotic cuisines. Book Kerela honeymoon on TravelTriangle. Best prices guaranteed. Colorful Kochi Munnar Honeymoon 4D/3N @ Rs 6,250 Plan your honeymoon today! Book Now See more at TRAVELTRIANGLE.COM Visit Website 2. Kappad Beach: Beach With Historical Importance Kappad has interesting history attached to it. The explorer Vasco Da Gama landed on the shores of the town Calicut now known as Kozhikode, when he docked in India in the year 1498. Another romantic getaway, this beach is serene and not too overwhelming which makes it one of the best beaches in Kerala. Things to do: Check out the thusharagiri falls, janaki forestPlaces to eat: M-grill, White House, Hotel ParagonPopular beach resorts: Kappad beach resort, WelcomHotel Raviz Kadavu Resort, Marina Residency Suggested Read: 4 Days In Kerala: Best Places To Visit And Amazing Things To Do 3. Kannur Beach: Lesser Known But Beautiful If you want to enjoy a book on a hammock or bathe in warm waters, Kannur is the perfect beach. A lesser known beach, it is not very crowded yet one of the best beaches in Kerala. No kidding, the setting is enough for anyone to fall in love with this beach. Things to do: Take a drive on the Muzhappilangad Drive-in, Check out the desolate Thottada beach and do not miss out on the cultural theyyamPlaces to eat: Sahib’s Grill kitchen, Hotel Odhens, Cabane BambouPopular beach resorts: Kannur beach house, Ocean Hues, Asokam Beach resort, Mascot beach resort Suggested Read: The Ultimate Kerala Honeymoon Bucket List 4. Marari Beach: For The Romantic Setting Marari beach in Kerala is a lover’s paradise. With high waves, turquoise skies and an expansive sandy beach, sitting on the shores of Marari is almost next to meditating. It is so serene and peaceful that it won’t be wrong to term it as the best beach in Kerala. Things to do: Enjoy the serenity of the desolate Mararikulam BeachPlaces to eat: Choola restaurant, Apsara Hotel, Himalaya Bake and more, Motel AraamPopular beach resorts: Marari beach resort, Marari pearl, Carnoustie Ayurveda and Wellness resort, Heritage heaven Suggested Read: 32 Things You Can Try While You’re On Your Trip To Kochi 5. Cherai Beach: Perfect For Beach Fishing Another one of the best beaches in Kerala, Cherai beach is near Kochi and is a nice place to enjoy beach fishing. The beach is clean and offers a serene environment to cuddle with your loved one. Make sure you include this place in your  romantic Kerala beaches itinerary. Things to do: If you’re up for it check out the Wonderla amusement park, The folklore museum, You may also sign up for the popular day tours and check out Kochi in the most relaxed way.Places to eat: The rice boat, fusion bay, Casa Linda, Solar Cafe, Chillout cafe at Cherai beachPopular beach resorts: Vivanta by Taj, Old Harbour Hotel, Agatti Island beach resort, Trident, Fort House, Eighth Bastion Hotel, Neemrana’s Le Colonial Suggested Read: 16 resorts in Kerala you will yearn to be with your sweetheart Planning your honeymoon in Kerala but confused about what to do? These Kerala honeymoon stories help you find your best honeymoon trip ever! Real honeymooners. Real stays. Real opinions to help you make the right choice. Read More See more at TRAVELTRIANGLE.COM Visit Website 6. Varkala Beach: Peaceful Is The Word Blue skies, coconut palms, lapping waters, cool sea breeze, sounds romantic, doesn’t it? Varkala is a beautiful coastal town and has some of the most peaceful seaside cliffs and good beaches in Kerala. Things to do: Laze on the shores of Varkala beach, take a boat ride on Lake Kappil, Check out the Ponnumthuruthu IslandPlaces to eat: Lhasa Restaurant, Coffee Temple, Abba Restaurant and Everest German bakery, The Juice shack, little TibetPopular beach resorts: Palm Tree heritage, The gateway hotel, Akhil beach resort Suggested Read: Kerala Honeymoon Guide For Couples Looking To Spice Up Their Love Life 7. Alappuzha Beach: Picturesque Got A New Name One of the most visited beaches in Kerala, Alappuzha is popularly referred to as Venice of the east. It is one of the most picturesque beaches of Alleppey. Besides the houseboats, Alappuzha also offers the perfect romantic setting for newlyweds and couples looking for beaches near Alleppey. Things to do: Take a boat ride, Catch a show of Kathakali, Kayaking and Canoeing can also be enjoyedPlaces to eat: Cafe Paradiso, Hot dishes, Cassia, Dreamers cafe and restaurantPopular beach resorts: Lemon tree, Vasundhara Sarovar Premiere, Punnamada resort, Darshan backwater resort, Alleppey beach resorts Suggested Read: 10 Most Offbeat Kerala Backwaters You Should Explore 8. Somatheeram Beach: Popular For The Ayurvedic Resort With an ayurvedic beach resort, it is the perfect getaway to calm your senses and enjoy the big waves lapping against the shores of Kerala. Somatheeram is like a big tropical garden beside a beach. Great ambiance, undisturbed beach bathing, and soothing calmness make this beach a romantic hotspot and it won’t be wrong to call it the best beach in Kerala for honeymoon. Things to do: Enjoy the comforts of the spas and ayurvedic centers, beach bathing and beach fishingPlaces to eat: Harmonia restaurant, Cafe de la mer, Coconut grovePopular beach resorts: Somatheeram Ayurveda resort, Travancore heritage Suggested Read: Kerala Vs Himachal For Honeymoon: Which Is The Ideal Retreat For Newlywed Couples? 9. Bekal Beach: Beach With A Fort Bekal beach and fort, for all its exotic charm, is the best sea beach in Kerala. Coupled with pristine waters, white sand and a postcard perfect fort, this beach will strum your romantic chords. Things to do: Explore the Chandragiri Fort and the Nityanandashram cavesPlaces to eat: Nombili, ViceroyPopular beach resorts: Vivanta by Taj, The Lalit resort and Spa, Bekal palace, Nirvana at Bekal Suggested Read: Kerala In November 2021: Places And Events Not To Be Missed Out 10. Payyoli Beach: Quiet & Desolate But Stunning Counted among comparatively good beaches in Kerala, Payyoli is rather quiet and desolate sojourn away from rush hour crowds! This beach is near Kozhikode and is a perfect romantic getaway. This beach is known for being a breeding ground for turtles. Watching baby turtles make their journey into the sea, what could be more romantic? Things to do: Check out the nearby Kappad beachPlaces to eat: Paragon, De Puttu, MezbanPopular beach resorts: Park residency, Hotel King fort, Alkapuri hotel Further Read: 5 Interesting Ways To Explore Kerala In January With Your Significant Other Oh, well! These are some of the many romantic beaches in Kerala that promise you the most beautiful time with your partner. You can visit these beaches for spending some quality time together or maybe just to win your lady’s heart by a beachside date. Liked this post? Wait no longer and plan a trip to Kerala and visit some of these beaches. We promise you a memorable time with you partner. Frequently Asked Questions Related To Beaches In Kerala Which Kerala beaches are best for swimming? Varkala Beach, Cherai Beach, Kuzhupilly Beach – 4 km from Cherai Beach run by Kuruvilla’s Family are some of the most appropriate Kerala beaches for swimming. Which Kerala beaches are ideal for foreign visitors? Lighthouse Beach, Marari Beach, Varkala Beach, and Fort Kochi are some of the most stunning and comforting beaches preferred by foreigners. All laced in greenery and nature’s perfect setting, visiting these beaches is one of the amazing things to do on a Kerala trip. Which is the most beautiful and romantic beach in Kerala? There is no one answer to that. There are many beautiful and romantic Kerala beaches that are beautiful and something that you must not miss out on. Some of the best beaches in Kerala are Marari Beach, Alappuzha Beach, and Kovalam Beach. Which is the most famous beach in Kerala? Kovalam Beach is one of the most beautiful beaches in Kerala. This is the most action-packed beach in Kerala and the fun is here. What activities can one try on beaches in Kerala? Some of the activities that you can try at the beaches in Kerala are parasailing, bamboo rafting, water surfing, kayaking, and windsurfing.
